sen.j: 竹久 夢二（たけひさ ゆめじ、明治17年（1884年）9月16日 - 昭和9年（1934年）9月1日）は、日本の画家・詩人。
sen.e: Yumeji TAKEHISA (September 16, 1884 to September 1, 1934) was both a Japanese painter and poet.
Yumeji TAKEHISA (September 16, 1884 to September 1, 1934) was a Japanese painter and poet.
Yumeji TAKEHISA (September 16, 1884 to September 1, 1934) was a Japanese painter and poet.

sen.j: 本名は、竹久 茂次郎（たけひさ もじろう）。
sen.e: His given name was Mojirou TAKEHISA.
He was born Mojirou TAKEHISA.
sen.cmt: "Given name" means 下の名前 only so it doesn't really work here.
sen.e: He was born Mojiro TAKEHISA.

sen.j: 数多くの美人画を残しており、その作品は「夢二式美人」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: He painted a lot of Bijinga (pictures of beautiful women), and those of his works were called 'Yumeji shiki bijin' (beautiful women of Yumeji style).

sen.j: 文筆の分野でも詩、歌謡、童話など創作した。
sen.e: He also created literary art such as poems, songs and nursery stories.

sen.e: He also created literary works such as poems, songs and nursery stories.

sen.j: なかでも詩「宵待草」には曲が付けられて大衆歌として受け、全国的な愛唱曲となった。
sen.e: Especially, his poem 'Yoimachi-gusa', which was melodized, became a popular song and was sung nationwide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In particular, his poem 'Yoimachi-gusa' was set to a melody, became a popular song and was sung nationwide.

sen.j: また、多くの書籍の装幀、広告宣伝物、日用雑貨のほか、浴衣などのデザインも手がけており、日本の近代グラフィックデザインの草分けのひとりとも言える。
sen.e: Moreover, he designed a lot of book covers, advertising items, daily goods and yukata (an informal cotton kimono for summer), and he was one of the pioneers of modern graphic design.
Moreover, he designed a lot of book covers, advertising items, daily goods and yukata (an informal cotton kimono for summer), and he was one of the pioneers of modern graphic design.
Moreover, he designed a lot of book covers, advertising items, daily goods and yukata (an informal cotton kimono for summer), and he was one of the pioneers of modern graphic design.

sen.j: 彼自身の独特な美意識による「夢二式美人画」と呼ばれる作品の多くは日本画の技法で描かれ（掛軸や屏風仕立てで遺る）、また洋画（キャンバスに油彩）技法による女性像や風景画も遺されている。
sen.e: Most of his works called 'Yumeji shiki bijin', which show his unique sense of beauty, were painted (on hanging scrolls and folding screens) by using Japanese painting techniques, but some images of women and landscape paintings were painted (on a canvas) by using oil painting techniques.

Most of his works called 'Yumeji shiki bijin', which show his unique sense of beauty, were painted on hanging scrolls and folding screens using Japanese painting techniques, but some images of women and landscapes were painted on canvas using oil painting techniques.
sen.cmt: Removed parentheses and edited slightly. "by using" is redundant
sen.e: Most of his works called 'Yumeji shiki bijin', which show his unique sense of beauty, were painted on hanging scrolls and folding screens using Japanese painting techniques, but some images of women and landscapes were painted on canvas using oil painting techniques.

sen.j: 好んで様々な表現形式を試みたが、むしろそれらは後世になってから評価されたもので、当時の時点においては印刷された書籍の表紙や広告美術などが多くの目に触れ、大衆人気というかたちで脚光を浴びたのであった。
sen.e: He tried various types of expressions, and although his works were valued as great art by later generations, his works in his time only gained great popularity among ordinary people as people often saw his works printed on the book covers or advertisements.

He experimented with various art styles, and although his works were valued as great art by later generations, in his own time his works only became popular among ordinary people because people often saw his works printed on book covers or in advertisements.
sen.cmt: Still a bit awkward but tried to make it flow better and sound more like natural English.
sen.e: He experimented with various art styles, and although his works were valued as great art by later generations, in his own time his works only became popular among ordinary people because people often saw his works printed on book covers or in advertisements.

sen.j: 一時は中央画壇への憧れもあったようだが受け入れられず、終生、野にあって新しい美術のあり方を模索した。
sen.e: He once yearned to join the Chuo art world but he was not accepted by them, so through his life, he did not belong to any group, but sought for vision in the new arts by himself.
sen.cmt: 中央画壇→Chuo art world ＜定訳不明＞
sen.e: He once sought to join the Chuo art world but he was not accepted by them, so throughout his life, he did not belong to any group, but instead searched alone for what new art techniques could express.
sen.cmt: Not sure on the last phrase, "atarashii bijutu no arikata." Otherwise edited for wording
sen.e: He once sought to join the Chuo art world but he was not accepted by them, so throughout his life, he did not belong to any group, but instead searched alone for what new art techniques could express.

sen.j: 世の動きとして見た場合、当時の画壇ではさまざまな芸術思潮が交錯し、ある意味で胎動期の不定のさなかである。
sen.e: Around that time, various art trends were being mixed in the art worlds, and in a sense, the art worlds were in the middle of the unstable phase of internal changes.
Around that time, various trends were being mixed in the art world, and in a sense, the art world was in the middle of an unstable phase of internal changes.
Around that time, various trends were being mixed in the art world, and in a sense, the art world was in the middle of an unstable phase of internal changes.

sen.j: 都市における大衆文化の開花による消費生活の拡大を背景とした、新しい応用美術としてのデザインというものの黎明の時代であり、夢二もこれに着目した。
sen.e: Since the consumption life-style was expanded by the flowering of popular culture in the cities, there came the dawn of new times where designs were started to be used as applied art, which Yumeji also focused attention on.

Since consumer lifestyle had been expanded by the flowering of popular culture in the cities, there came the dawn of new times where designs started to be used as applied art, which is an area that Yumeji also focused on.
sen.cmt: Still a bit convoluted. Edited for flow and readability
sen.e: Since consumer lifestyle had been expanded by the flowering of popular culture in the cities, there came the dawn of new times where designs started to be used as applied art, which is an area that Yumeji also focused on.

sen.j: 生涯の後期にいたっては、彼の図案家としての才能の実績において、生活と結びついた美術を目指し、あるいは産業と融合すべきとの理念を持ち、むしろ積極的に、商業美術（のちにいわれるグラフィック・デザイン）の概念を描いていたようである。
sen.e: In his later life, with his ability as a designer, he seemed to have actively delineated the concept of commercial art (which became referred to as graphic design later), aiming for the arts related to life or believing that art should be integrated with industry.

In his later life, thanks to his ability as a designer, he seemed to have actively delineated the concept of commercial art (later referred to as graphic design), aiming for art which relates to life, or in other words, the belief that art should be integrated with industry.

In his later life, thanks to his ability as a designer, he seemed to have actively delineated the concept of commercial art (later referred to as graphic design), aiming for art which relates to life, or in other words, the belief that art should be integrated with industry.

sen.j: 榛名山産業美術研究所の構想や、先進欧米視察への野望が、このことを裏付けている。
sen.e: This can be exemplified by his vision of the Mr. Aruna Institute of Industrial Art and his ambition to visit advanced western countries.
sen.cmt: 「榛名山産業美術研究所」→Mt. Aruna Institute of Industrial Art＜定訳不明＞
sen.e: This was exemplified by his vision for the Mount Haruna Institute of Industrial Art and his ambition to visit advanced western countries.

sen.e: When Yumeji had a relationship with Hikono in 1915, he became suspicious about the relationship between Tamaki and an art student, Seiji TOGO (Seiji), and thus he stabbed her in the arm at the beach of Toyama Prefecture, resulting in them breaking up forever.

When Yumeji had a relationship with Hikono in 1915, he became suspicious about the relationship between Tamaki and an art student, Seiji TOGO (Seiji), and thus he stabbed her in the arm at the beach of Toyama Prefecture, resulting in them breaking up forever.

sen.j: しかしながら、たまきは夢二亡き後も終生彼を慕い続けたという。
sen.e: Tamaki, however, loved Yumeji through her life even after he died.

sen.j: 笠井 彦乃（1896年3月29日 - 1920年1月16日、山梨県南巨摩郡西島村（現・身延町西島）生まれ、本名はヒコノ。別名に山路しの）
sen.e: Hikono KASAI (March 29, 1896 to January 16, 1920; She was born in Nishijima-mura, Minami-koma-gun, Yamanashi Prefecture [present day, Nishijima, Minobu-cho]; Her real name was Hikono.

sen.cmt: 後列の「別名に山路しの）」は同じ（）内なのでここににまとめました。原文も後列からこちらの移動しました。

sen.j: 日本橋の紙問屋の娘として裕福に育ち、女子美術大学の学生であった。
sen.e: Her alias name was Shino YAMAJI.) She grew up as a daughter of a wealthy family that owned a wholesale store for paper in Nihonbashi, and she was a student at the Joshibi University of Art and Design.

sen.j: 夢二のファンであり、絵を習いたいと「港屋絵草子店」を訪問し、交際が始まる。
sen.e: She was a big fan of Yumeji, and thus visited his store 'Minatoya esoushi-ten' to learn about painting, resulting in their relationship.

sen.j: たまきと別れ京都に移り住んだ夢二としばらく同棲するが、大正7年（1918年）九州旅行中の夢二を追う途中、別府温泉で結核を発病。
sen.e: She was living with Yumeji after he broke up with Tamaki and moved to Kyoto, however in 1918, she became sick with tuberculosis in Beppu hot spring when she was on the way to meet Yumeji who was travelling in Kyusyu.

sen.j: 父の手によって東京に連れ戻され、夢二は本郷菊富士ホテルに移るが、面会を遮断される。
sen.e: Her father took her back to Tokyo and blocked Yumeji from seeing her when Yumeji moved back to the Hongo Kikufuji Hotel to see her.

sen.j: 御茶ノ水順天堂医院に入院した彦乃は、そのまま短い人生を終える。
sen.e: Hikono was admitted to the Ochanomizu Juntendo-iin Hospital and her short life ended there.

sen.e: Yumeji seems to have loved her the most, and thus he could not get over her death for a long time.

sen.j: お葉（1904年3月11日 - 1980年10月24日、秋田県出身、本名は永井カ子ヨ）は、上京後、東京藝術大学のモデル (職業)として人気があった。
sen.e: Oyo (March 11, 1904 to October 24, 1980; She was from Akita; Her real name was Kaneyo NAGAI) was popular as a model at Tokyo University of the Arts after she moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: 藤島武二、伊藤晴雨らのモデルをつとめた後に、菊富士ホテルに逗留していた夢二のモデルとして通ううちに同棲、渋谷区（現在の渋谷ビーム、同地に石碑あり）に所帯をもつ。
sen.e: After working for Takeji FUJISHIMA and Seiu ITO as a model, she worked for Yumeji as model when he was making a long stay at Kikufuji Hotel, and then started living with him in a house in Shibuya Ward (present day, Shibuya BEAM, which has a stone monument).

sen.j: 大正13年（1924年）、夢二が設計した世田谷「少年山荘」に一緒に移り住んだ。
sen.e: In 1924, she moved to a house that Yumeji designed, called 'Shonen Sanso', in Setagaya Ward.

sen.j: 翌14年にお葉は自殺を図り、半年後に別離する。
